member.name: M:Kook.IChannel.GetUsersAsync(Kook.CacheMode,Kook.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a collection of users that are able to view the channel or are currently in this channel.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
This method will attempt to fetch all users that is able to view this channel or is currently in this channel. The library will attempt to split up the requests according to and . In other words, if there are 3000 users, and the constant is 50, the request will be split into 60 individual requests; thus returning 60 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.
member.param: The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of users.

The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get operation. The task result contains a user object that represents the found user; null if none is found.

member.name: M:Kook.IMessageChannel.GetMessagesAsync(System.Int32,Kook.CacheMode,Kook.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets the last N messages from this message channel.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
Do not fetch too many messages at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!
This method will attempt to fetch the number of messages specified under . The library will attempt to split up the requests according to your and . In other words, should the user request 500 messages, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 5 individual requests; thus returning 5 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.
member.param: The numbers of message to be gotten from.
The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of messages.

member.name: M:Kook.IMessageChannel.GetMessagesAsync(System.Guid,Kook.Direction,System.Int32,Kook.CacheMode,Kook.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a collection of messages in this channel.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
Do not fetch too many messages at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!
This method will attempt to fetch the number of messages specified under around the message depending on the . The library will attempt to split up the requests according to your and . In other words, should the user request 500 messages, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 5 individual requests; thus returning 5 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.
member.param: The ID of the starting message to get the messages from.
The direction of the messages to be gotten from.
The numbers of message to be gotten from.
The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of messages.

Setting this value will require each user to wait before sending another message; setting this value to will disable slow-mode for this channel; if this value is set to null, the slow-mode interval will not be modified.

member.name: P:Kook.IGuildUser.Color
member.summary: Gets the color the user's displayed name is being displayed in.
member.returns: A struct representing the color the user's display name is being displayed in.

remarks.note: At present, the color of a role may be a solid color or a gradient. See , which is guaranteed due to the fact that the guild's user list API endpoint returns the color type and the gradient color information if exists. However, the value of this property is fetched from the guild's user list API endpoint, which does not return the color type and the gradient color information. Hence, the value of this property may be incorrect if the color of a role is a gradient.

member.name: M:Kook.IUser.CreateDMChannelAsync(Kook.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Creates the direct message channel of this user.
member.remarks:
This method is used to obtain or create a channel used to send a direct message.
In event that the current user cannot send a message to the target user, a channel can and will still be created by Kook. However, attempting to send a message will yield a with a 403 as its . There are currently no official workarounds by Kook.
member.param: The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation for getting or creating a DM channel. The task result contains the DM channel associated with this user.

member.name: M:Kook.Format.Sanitize(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Sanitizes the string, safely escaping any Markdown sequences.
member.param: The text to sanitize.
The characters to sanitize.
member.returns: Gets the sanitized text.
member.remarks: If no sensitive characters are specified, the default sensitive characters are used. The default sensitive characters are: \, *, ~, `, :, -, ], ), >.

member.name: M:Kook.Format.Quote(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Formats a string as split quotes seperated by multiple new lines.
member.param: The text to format.
Whether to sanitize the text.
member.returns: Gets the formatted quote text.

remarks.note: Due to the mechanism of the KOOK KMarkdown renderer, this method recognizes multiple text blocks based on two or more consecutive line breaks, and formats each block as a quote. For each text block, a greater than sign (>) and a space is inserted at the beginning of the string, and a zero-width joiner (\u200d) is inserted when the beginning of the block is a whitespace character, to ensure proper display of the quote. When the user copies the text inside the quote, they will not copy this special character. However, if you obtain the message text from the server through message-related APIs, it will contain the special character inserted by this method. An additional line break is also appended at the end of the block to correct any missing line breaks caused by the quote formatting. The appended line break is consistent with the style of the nearby line breaks. To quote the entire text as a whole, use instead.
remarks.para: Set to true will sanitize the text by replacing all occurrences of > with \>.

member.name: M:Kook.Format.Underline(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a markdown-formatted string with underline formatting.
member.param: The text to format.
Whether to sanitize the text.
member.returns: Gets the formatted underlined text.
member.remarks: Set to true will sanitize the text by replacing all occurrences of ( and ) with \( and \).

member.name: M:Kook.Format.Spoiler(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a string with spoiler formatting.
member.param: The text to format.
Whether to sanitize the text.
member.returns: Gets the formatted spoiled text.
member.remarks: Set to true will sanitize the text by replacing all occurrences of ( and ) with \( and \).

member.name: M:Kook.Format.Code(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a markdown-formatted string with inline code or code block formatting.
member.param: The text to format.
The language of the code block.
Whether to sanitize the text.
member.returns: Gets the formatted inline code or code block.
member.remarks: Set to true will sanitize the text by replacing all occurrences of ` with \`.

member.name: M:Kook.Format.CodeBlock(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a markdown-formatted string with code block formatting.
member.param: The text to format.
The language of the code block.
Whether to sanitize the text.
member.returns: Gets the formatted code block.
member.remarks: Set to true will sanitize the text by replacing all occurrences of ` with \`.

member.name: M:Kook.Format.BlockQuote(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Formats a string as a block quote as a whole.
member.param: The text to format.
Whether to sanitize the text.
member.returns: Gets the formatted block quote text.

remarks.note: Due to the working mechanism of the KOOK KMarkdown renderer, this method will insert zero-width joiner special characters (\u200d) before the first empty line and between each empty line in the text by default, so that the renderer can display the entire text as a single quote. When the user copies the text inside the quote, they will not copy this special character. However, if you obtain the message text from the server through message-related APIs, it will contain the special character inserted by this method. If you want to disable this feature, please use instead.
remarks.para: Set to true will sanitize the text by replacing all occurrences of > with \>.

member.name: T:Kook.TokenUtils
member.summary: Provides a series of helper methods for handling Kook login tokens.

member.name: F:Kook.TokenUtils.MinBotTokenLength
member.summary: The minimum length of a Bot token.
member.remarks: This value was determined by comparing against the examples in the Kook documentation, and pre-existing tokens.

member.name: F:Kook.TokenUtils.StandardBotTokenLength
member.summary: The standard length of a Bot token.
member.remarks: This value was determined by comparing against the examples in the Kook documentation, and pre-existing tokens.

member.name: M:Kook.TokenUtils.PadBase64String(System.String)
member.summary: Pads a base64-encoded string with 0, 1, or 2 '=' characters, if the string is not a valid multiple of 4. Does not ensure that the provided string contains only valid base64 characters. Strings that already contain padding will not have any more padding applied.
member.remarks: A string that would require 3 padding characters is considered to be already corrupt. Some older bot tokens may require padding, as the format provided by Kook does not include this padding in the token.
member.param: The base64 encoded string to pad with characters.
member.returns: A string containing the base64 padding.
member.exception: Thrown if would require an invalid number of padding characters.
Thrown if is null, empty, or whitespace.

member.name: M:Kook.TokenUtils.DecodeBase64UserId(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a base 64 encoded string into a ulong value.
member.param: A base 64 encoded string containing a User Id.
member.returns: A ulong containing the decoded value of the string, or null if the value was invalid.

member.name: M:Kook.TokenUtils.CheckBotTokenValidity(System.String)
member.summary: Checks the validity of a bot token by attempting to decode a ulong userid from the bot token.
member.param: The bot token to validate.
member.returns: true if the token is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: F:Kook.TokenUtils.IllegalTokenCharacters
member.summary: The set of all characters that are not allowed inside of a token.

member.name: M:Kook.TokenUtils.CheckContainsIllegalCharacters(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given token contains a whitespace or newline character that would fail to log in.
member.param: The token to validate.
member.returns: true if the token contains a whitespace or newline character.

member.name: M:Kook.TokenUtils.ValidateToken(Kook.TokenType,System.String)
member.summary: Checks the validity of the supplied token of a specific type.
member.param: The type of token to validate.
The token value to validate.
member.exception: Thrown when the supplied token string is null, empty, or contains only whitespace.
Thrown when the supplied or token value is invalid.

member.name: M:Kook.Utils.UrlValidation.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Not full URL validation right now. Just ensures protocol is present and that it's either http or https.
member.param: The URL to validate before sending to Kook.
member.exception: A URL must include a protocol (http or https).
member.returns: true if URL is valid by our standard, false if null, throws an error upon invalid.

member.name: M:Kook.Utils.UrlValidation.ValidateKookAssetUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that the URL represents an asset on the Kook OSS server.
member.remarks:
This method checks the URL from 3 parts:
The scheme must be either http or https
The host must be one of the following:
img.kaiheila.cn
img.kookapp.cn
kaiheila.oss-cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com
The path must in the form of the following:
/assets/2021-01/7kr4FkWpLV0ku0ku.jpeg
/assets/2022-01/21/HwuGGgpohG0ku0ku.jpeg
/attachments/2022-08/19/GHUrXywopm1hc0u0.png
member.param: The URL to validate before sending to Kook.
member.exception: The URL provided is not an asset on the Kook OSS.
member.returns: true if URL represents a valid asset on the Kook OSS, false if null, throws an error upon invalid.
